title: Represent and analyze - maxima from pendulum graph

content.question: A simple pendulum is oscillating in simple harmonic motion, and its angular displacement as a function of time is shown in the graph. Which of the following statements about the angular speed and the magnitude of the angular acceleration of the pendulum is correct?

choices.label: The angular speed is a maximum at <math alttext="1 second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></math> and <math alttext="3 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></math>, and the magnitude of the angular acceleration is a maximum at <math alttext="0 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></math>, <math alttext="2 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>2</mtext><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></math>, and <math alttext="4 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></math>.

The angular speed is a maximum at <math alttext="0 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></math>, <math alttext="2 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>2</mtext><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></math>, and <math alttext="4 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></math>, and the magnitude of the angular acceleration is a maximum at <math alttext="1 second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></math> and <math alttext="3 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></math>.

Both the angular speed and the magnitude of the angular acceleration are maximum at <math alttext="1 second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></math> and <math alttext="3 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></math>.

Both the angular speed and the magnitude of the angular acceleration are maximum at <math alttext="0 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></math>, <math alttext="2 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>2</mtext><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></math>, and <math alttext="4 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></math>.

content.answer: The angular speed is a maximum at <math alttext="0 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></math>, <math alttext="2 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>2</mtext><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></math>, and <math alttext="4 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></math>, and the magnitude of the angular acceleration is a maximum at <math alttext="1 second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></math> and <math alttext="3 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></math>.
